Selected Answer: AD
A. Virtual IP addresses are used to distinguish between cluster members.
D. A change in the virtual IP address happens when a FortiGate device joins or leaves the cluster. 

FortiGate Infrastructure 7.2 Study Guide (p.301):
"FGCP automatically assigns the heartbeat IP addresses based on the serial number of each device. The IP address 169.254.0.1 is assigned to the device with the highest serial number."
"A change in the heartbeat IP addresses may happen when a FortiGate device joins or leaves the cluster."
"The HA cluster uses the heartbeat IP addresses to distinguish the cluster members and synchronize data."

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-infrastructure-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html

Selected Answer: AD
Answer A and D.

A. Virtual IP addresses are used to distinguish between cluster members. [CORRECT]
"The HA cluster uses the heartbeat IP addresses TO DISTINGUISH THE CLUSTER MEMBERS and synchronize data."

B. Heartbeat interfaces have virtual IP addresses that are manually assigned. [WRONG]
"FGCP AUTOMATICALLY assigns the heartbeat IP addresses based on the serial number of each device."

C. The primary device in the cluster is always assigned IP address 169.254.0.1. [WRONG]
"The IP address 169.254.0.1 is assigned to the device with the HIGHEST SERIAL NUMBER."

D. A change in the virtual IP address happens when a FortiGate device joins or leaves the cluster. [CORRECT]
"A change in the heartbeat IP addresses may happen when a FortiGate device joins or leaves the cluster."

Reference: FortiGate 7.4 Study Guide
AD is a valid response

Answers are A and D
Fortigate Infrastructure 7.2 Study Guide page 301

Selected Answer: AD
The answers are A and D

Yes A and D.

choices.C: Advanced mode uses the Windows convention—NetBios: Domain\Username.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
FortiGate Infrastructure 7.2 Study Guide 146, the answer is AD.
Also, advanced mode supports nested or inherited groups; that is, users can be members of subgroups that belong to monitored parent groups.
In advanced mode, you can configure FortiGate as an LDAP client and configure the group filters on FortiGate.
AD is a valid response

Selected Answer: AD
A. In advanced mode, FortiGate can be configured as an LDAP client and group filters can be configured on FortiGate.
D. Advanced mode supports nested or inherited groups.

FortiGate Infrastructure 7.2 Study Guide (p.146):
"Also, advanced mode supports nested or inherited groups; that is, users can be members of subgroups that belong to monitored parent groups."
"In advanced mode, you can configure FortiGate as an LDAP client and configure the group filters on FortiGate. You can also configure group filters on the collector agent."

Reference and download study guide:
https://ebin.pub/fortinet-fortigate-infrastructure-study-guide-for-fortios-72.html

A and D. Infrastructure guide 7.2, pag. 146:
- In advanced mode, you can configure FortiGate as an LDAP client and configure the group filters on FortiGate.
- Also, advanced mode supports nested or inherited groups.

C. Incorrect, Netbios is Standard mode.
B. Incorrect, in Advanced mode, FortiGate can apply security profiles to individual users, user groups, and OUs
